newsitem.title: FRANCE: France condemns clubbing by Belgrade police.
newsitem.headline: France condemns clubbing by Belgrade police.

text.p: France condemned Belgrade police on Tuesday for clubbing demonstrators and again urged the Belgrade government to recognise municipal elections which have prompted nine weeks of mass street protests.
"We strongly deplore the violence committed yesterday evening in Belgrade against several demonstrators," Foreign Ministry spokesman Jacques Rummelhardt told reporters.
He said the incidents were all the more worrying given the fact that Belgrade was resorting to legal quibbling to delay recognising the elections.

"We therefore once again caution the Belgrade authorities against any attempt to use repression and we invite them not to delay any longer the recognition of the electoral results of November 17, 1996," Rummelhardt said.

The street protests over the nullified municipal elections won by an opposition bloc degenerated into rare violence on Monday night when weary riot police dispensed with restraint and clubbed some demonstrators in Belgrade.
Serbia's Zajedno (Together) opposition coalition is campaigning to reverse Socialist authorities' annulment of election results in 14 major Serbian towns on grounds of murky "irregularities".
